{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which of the following is not a function of guiding plane, we need to understand the purpose and functions of a guiding plane in dentistry. The guiding plane is a flat surface on a tooth or dental restoration that helps guide the insertion and removal of a removable partial denture. It provides stability, support, and retention for the denture. It also helps distribute forces evenly to the abutment teeth and prevents displacement of the restoration. Based on this information, we can evaluate each option to determine which one is not a function of the guiding plane.", "answer_choice": "A"}
